meanings.definition: To surpass in organization or efficiency.
meanings.sent1: She outorganized her classmates by color-coding her notes.
meanings.sent2: The new filing system outorganized the old one by a mile.
meanings.sent3: The ants outorganized the picnic-goers by quickly finding the crumbs.
meanings.sent4: His strategic planning outorganized the competition, leaving them in awe.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's lesson on time management really drove home how to outorganize chaos.

meanings.definition: To be more organized than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: He always outorganizes his siblings when it comes to cleaning their room.
meanings.sent2: The new employee quickly outorganized her colleagues with her neat desk.
meanings.sent3: The cat outorganized the dog by neatly arranging its toys in a row.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous planning outorganized everyone else's efforts.
meanings.sent5: The team leader's ability to outorganize the chaos saved the project from disaster.
